inclusion.criterion: Acute presentation with abdominal pain and/or tenderness which is most marked in the right lower abdomen
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with a firm clinical diagnosis of appendicitis where surgical management is indicated at presentation
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients who have undergone CT scanning within the past two months
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with cognitive impairment who would lack capacity to give consent
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Inability to understand written or spoken English
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who have previously undergone appendicectomy
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient is a 31-year-old woman with acute presentation of abdominal pain and tenderness in the right lower abdomen. Computed Tomography shows a distended appendix without perforation, abscess or gangrene.
